Inserters
[The FastFormat (C++) Application Layer]

Detailed Description

Inserter components, to allow explicit insertion of arbitrary types into FastFormat write()/fmt() statements.


Functions

Function Documentation

ximpl_character::character_state fastformat::inserters::character ( ff_char_t const &  value  )  [inline]

Inserts the string form of a character value.

Parameters:
value The character value to be inserted.

ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::integer ( I const &  value,
int  minimumWidth,
int  precision 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of an integral value.

Parameters:
value The integral value to be converted to string form
minimumWidth The minimum width of the result. If negative, the integer is aligned to the left of the resulting field
precision The minimum number of digits in the field, which will result in zero-padding if the given integer has fewer digits
Returns:
An instance of an insertable type containing the string form of the integer
Precondition:
abs(minimumWidth) < 512

decimalPlaces <= minimumWidth

stlsoft::basic_shim_string<ff_char_t, 64> fastformat::inserters::real ( double const &  value,
int  minimumWidth,
int  decimalPlaces,
ff_char_t  type 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of a floating-point value, with the given width, precision and type.

Parameters:
value The double value to be converted to string form
minimumWidth The minimum width of the resulting string form. If non-negative, the result will be right-aligned. If negative, the result will be left-aligned
decimalPlaces The number of decimal places to be included
type One of the following characters that denote the type of the floating-point representation: e, E, f, F, g, or G
Precondition:
abs(minimumWidth) < 512

decimalPlaces <= minimumWidth

stlsoft::basic_shim_string<ff_char_t, 64> fastformat::inserters::real ( double const &  value,
int  minimumWidth,
int  decimalPlaces 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of a floating-point value, with the given width and precision.

Parameters:
value The double value to be converted to string form
minimumWidth The minimum width of the resulting string form. If non-negative, the result will be right-aligned. If negative, the result will be left-aligned
decimalPlaces The number of decimal places to be included
Precondition:
abs(minimumWidth) < 512

decimalPlaces <= abs(minimumWidth)

ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::to_i ( ULARGE_INTEGER const &  value,
int  minimumWidth = ximpl_integer::default_width_sentinel_(),
int  precision = ximpl_integer::default_precision_sentinel_() 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of a ULARGE_INTEGER value.

Parameters:
value The ULARGE_INTEGER value to be converted to string form
minimumWidth The minimum width of the result. If negative, the integer is aligned to the left of the resulting field
precision The minimum number of digits in the field, which will result in zero-padding if the given integer has fewer digits
Returns:
An instance of an insertable type containing the string form of the integer
Precondition:
abs(minimumWidth) < 512

decimalPlaces <= minimumWidth

int  nullIfZero

Pseudonym for to_i_null_if_zero().

fastformat::inserters::ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::to_i_null_if_0 ( I const &  i  )  [inline]

Pseudonym for to_i_null_if_zero().

fastformat::inserters::ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::to_i_null_if_not ( I const &  i,
I const &  sentinel,
int  nullIfSame 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of an integral value, or an empty string in the case where the value is zero if the parameter nullIfZero is non-zero.

Parameters:
i The integral value to be converted to string form.
sentinel The value to which i will be compared for exclusion.
nullIfSame Causes a "0" to be replaced by the empty string
Returns:
An instance of an insertable type containing the string form of the integer
Precondition:
I is an integral type

fastformat::inserters::ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::to_i_null_if_not ( I const &  i,
I const &  sentinel 
) [inline]

Inserts the string form of an integral value, or an empty string in the case where the value is zero.

Parameters:
i The integral value to be converted to string form.
sentinel The value to which i will be compared for exclusion.
Returns:
An instance of an insertable type containing the string form of the integer
Precondition:
I is an integral type

) [inline]

ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ fastformat::inserters::to_X ( I const &  value,
int  minimumWidth,
int  precision 
) [inline]

Inserts the hexadecimal string form of an integral value.

Parameters:
value The integral value to be converted to hexadecimal string form
minimumWidth The minimum width of the result. If negative, the integer is aligned to the left of the resulting field
precision The minimum number of digits in the field, which will result in zero-padding if the given integer has fewer digits
Returns:
An instance of an insertable type containing the string form of the integer
Precondition:
I is an integral type

abs(minimumWidth) < 512

decimalPlaces <= minimumWidth
